p: C. intybus contains caffeic acids and flavonoids. Many studies regarding flavonoids (as rutin, quercetin, luteolin and apigenin) show diuretic and nephroprotective properties [ 73, 74, 75, 76]. Also, polyphenolic acids have been studied for major role in reestablishing renal function subsequently to oxidative stress [ 77]. Cichoric acid renal effects were evaluated in a previous study, showing that it can prevent methotrexate-induced AKI by decreasing ROS (reactive oxygen species)-induced activation of NF-ÎºB/NLRP3 inflammatory pathway [ 68].
